com.pump.xray

Class ClassWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.xray.StreamWriter
      • com.pump.xray.ClassWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<StreamWriter>

    public class ClassWriter
extends StreamWriter
    This writer is responsible for one Class object (which can be a "class", "interface" or "enum").

    This class will write a "hollow" or "empty" java source code file that resembles signatures from a java.lang.Class object. (The moniker "mock object" has a special meaning, and it's not really appropriate to call this a mock object.)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClassWriter

        public ClassWriter(java.lang.Class type,
                   boolean autopopulate)
        Create a ClassWriter with no SourceCodeManager.
        Parameters:
        type - the class this ClassWriter will mock/fake.
        autopopulate - if true then autopopulate() is called to build a reasonable set of basic fields/constructors/members.

      • ClassWriter

        public ClassWriter(SourceCodeManager sourceCodeManager,
                   java.lang.Class type,
                   boolean autopopulate)
        Create a ClassWriter.
        Parameters:
        sourceCodeManager - the optional SourceCodeManager that is used to index dependencies that this ClassWriter identifies. For example if representing the class java.lang.Thread requires the method java.util.Map, then that method will be added to the sourceCodeManager when this object writes data.
        type - the class this ClassWriter will mock/fake.
        autopopulate - if true then autopopulate() is called to build a reasonable set of basic fields/constructors/members.

    • Method Detail

      • autopopulate

        protected void autopopulate()
        This grabs basic fields/constructors/methods from the Class this ClassWriter emulates. Generally this grabs non-private elements, but there are a few more subtle rules, too:
        • No synthetic fields
        • If no non-private constructors were found, we include private constructors
        • No synthetic methods.

      • writeEnumBody

        protected void writeEnumBody(ClassWriterStream cws)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Write an enum body (enum constants, fields, methods). Constructors are omitted, because 3rd parties will never need to construct an enum.
        Parameters:
        cws - the stream to write to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getDeclaredType

        public ClassWriter getDeclaredType(java.lang.Class declaredType)
        Return the ClassWriter associated with a declared (member/nested) type, or null if no ClassWriter is identified.

      • isJavadocEnabled

        public boolean isJavadocEnabled()
        Return true if the javadoc-enabled flag is active. If this is true then the topmost declaration in this ClassWriter will receive a small javadoc explanation of how this code was autogenerated.

      • setJavadocEnabled

        public void setJavadocEnabled(boolean b)
        Set the javadoc-enabled flag.
